website_summaries.verdict: A durable, all-purpose cordless trimmer with a 22-inch blade and a cushioned gripping area.
pros: This dynamic unit offers much of the power, features, and reach of trimmers twice the price
The cushioned grip and vibration-reducing blades help keep the user from fatiguing while working
The 22-inch blade can handle branches up to 0.75 inches thick
cons: This unit does not come with a battery or charger
It's best for people who already own a 20-volt battery and charger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and maneuverable. Lose the cord and gain freedom. I used to have a corded version of this also by B&D, but once I cut the cord by mistake - oops. With this battery operated one, you no longer have to worry about cutting your own cord while shaping your bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION FIRE HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: Fire Hazard, caught fire with less than five minutes of use, I was able to get it into a steel barrel before it could cause any personnel or property damage. Amazon is going to refund the trimmer, but lost the battery.
customer_reviews.author: G. Aitken

customer_reviews.title: This is one serious hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I feel like a badass using this thing. Being a petite older lady I needed something lightweight and cordless. This hedge trimmer can cut some serious hedges! I couldn’t stop trimming hedges down simply because it was awesome, I even went to my neighbors yard and did theirs (don’t worry, I asked first.) The price was fantastic. Plus the battery fit my B&D drill which was even better! Love this thing. May file it under my list of favorite power tools for “when you want something done, do it yourself”.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyMama

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth Getting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the BD LHT2220B 20V Li Ion hedge trimmer to replace a similar corded one because I got sick of the effort it took to set up the extension cord. My main concern was whether the cordless version had adequate power and length on time to do the job. I needn't have worried. It had comparable power to my corded one as well as lots of battery time, with the convenience of being cordless. I would definitely recommend this trimmer to anyone who wants to cut the cord for the convenience of just slipping on the battery and getting to work.
customer_reviews.author: F. Pono

customer_reviews.title: Great all around hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: -Price point was great compared to other options on Amazon. -The battery life was excellent. I was able to do all the vines on my fence and I used it to help cut down bushes in my backyard that I couldn't get at with the mower. -Not sure how much actual run time I used (maybe around 30 minutes) but the battery lasted the entire time I was working. -As stated in the description it handled around 3/4" thick branches. -It was lightweight and very easy to use and maneuver any direction I need to cut, even using it one handed I had no troubles. It definitely beats having a gas or corded trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: nevinator23

customer_reviews.title: Nice cordless trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer since I already the weeding/edging tool that uses the same battery. I was surprised how well this worked. Fairly light, sharp and so much easier to maneuver since it is cordless. I trimmed my three boxwood bushes is so much less time than before. Granted all trimmers have a max capacity of what it can cut and the user needs to recognize that. But it is just so much safer without the cord. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Evergreen58

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Had the same hedge trimmer for 2 years , before the motor burnt. Bought another one in August 2020, same brand as the batteries were still good ( and even if B&D and Dewalt are the same company, they make batteries not interchangeable ...) motor stopped after 3 X light use! Past Amazon return dead line, so opened it to discover wires pinched in the frame , Melting and shorting the unit.. Compared the wires with the old One :new one has wires half the thickness of the old one..Very disappointing product, poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimmer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice trimmer that is easy to handle. Battery life is good for trimming a lot of shrubs for quite a long time. So I would rate battery life as excellent. I've had zero problems with it in 5 years of occasional seasonal midwest USA use. The cutting edges are still sharp and material cuts are clean. It shows no signs of having any problem any time soon. Very pleased with the purchase and kudos to Black & Decker for making a solid product in a time where a lot of products are designed to have a fairly limited life span.
customer_reviews.author: "Larry"

customer_reviews.title: First one worked well and was very tough.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in a local store about 5 years ago. I was very impressed with its cutting power, battery life, and durability. It was still working fine until recently when it was damaged by cutting into a metal stake that was obscured by foliage. I ordered this replacement and so far it is performing just as well as the original, and I am even using the battery from the original one which still performs strong. A lot of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: B&D cordless Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for. I had an electric one, and it worked just fine, but I was tired of dealing with the cord. I'm so glad I bought this cordless hedge trimmer. It does a good job and is easy to use. I used it to trim some shrubs, which took me about 45 minutes to an hour and had no loss of battery power. It's not too heavy, but doesn't feel flimsy. I'm very happy with the trimmer and which I bought it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!  Wish I bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life! I wish I had bought it much sooner. I was so tired of having to plug my electric trimmer into extension cords and drag them around. This has just as much power as the electric version but it's so much easier to use all around my property. I already had the Black & Decker batteries. I get quite a bit of time out of one battery charge. More time than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and long lasting battery!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a smaller handheld trimmer and it was fine for small jobs, but when I needed to trim the big bushes, I purchased this. It is very lightweight so you don’t get tired using it. The battery life was great in my opinion. It lasted the entire time I was trimming bushes. It cut right through everything I was trimming, even some thicker branches in the bush. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for the job at hand
customer_reviews.text: Worked great even on larger saplings and branches. I used it to tame my neighbors growth infringing into my yard. Vines entangling fallen tree branches will stop a chain saw, and is too much individual cuts to make by hand with tree branch clippers, so the hedge trimmer is the only useful tool for this type of job and multiple other uses like sapling brush growth, which is also to much to do by hand.
customer_reviews.author: musiciantech

customer_reviews.title: Was shockingly good (no pun intended)
customer_reviews.text: I've got a bunch of B&D 20 V batteries and tools. Bought this on a lark thinking I would use it to touch up my bushes between trimmings. I was genuinely surprised at how well it cut. I started using it to do all the trimming on the 20 small bushes I have. Granted, it's not the best choice for 200' of 6' boxhedge, but for small bushes it does great, and no more cord to tangle or risk cutting in two.
customer_reviews.author: Rootman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Black and Decker's 20V battery that came with weed trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I purchased this hedge trimmer over Sun Joe's corded one was because I thought I could use my Black and Decker weed Trimmer's 20V lithium battery with this one but the battery was longer than hedge trimmer's base was. Even after clicking the battery, it kept sliding out. Because of this, I couldn't even try the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Raya

customer_reviews.title: Very Surprised. May sell my gas trimmer?
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to handle. Standard battery last through several jobs. I have a large Stihl gas trimmer and just got tired of the noise and dealing with maintenance. I already have several black & decker 20v tools and figured I would give this a try. Trimmed a 20ft box hedge, 5 rounded junipers and a few other small plants. I was curious how this would do on juniper which is as tuff a plant for any hedger. This little trimmer made easy work of juniper, has great handleability and easy to use. Battery time is very good on a standard 20v. Looks like my gas trimmer may get sold at the garage sale next year.
customer_reviews.author: NTODWILD

customer_reviews.title: NEED A TRIM?
customer_reviews.text: Sure makes life easier. Want to trim the shrubs, do some now and some later.. No problem as there is no set-up. You don't need to drag out the extension cords, and then trip over them, or cut into them with the trimmer. You just go out and trim. Quit when you want. Now extentions to wind up. So....why just a "4"....the battery cut is not as powerful as the plug-in (electric) so it won't cut some of branches. Just like the electric is not as powerful as the gas. But, all in all....I'll stick with the battery and if fits my other tools as well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a landscaper by trade and I have really bought in to going green, It's easy when the tools work this good. These hedge trimmers are light weight and super sharp!! I own the Black & Decker 20 volt Weed Eater, Blower, Pole Saw and noe the Hedge Trimmers. They all work great!! I bought a 2 pack of after market batteries and with the batteries each tool came with I have 6 batteries all together, I can work all day and not come close to using battery # 6. I would highly recommend this Hedge Trimmer if you have any kind of bushes or small limbs that need to be trimmed
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: It came without a battery or a charger. None of the contact manufacturer options worked. Message form just gives error code. No email. Online chat link doesn't open. Calling gives infinite hold due to large call volume. Turns out the battery AND the charger are each sold separately...doubling the price of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Houston

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for..
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hedger trimmer to complement my Black & Decker edger and backyard blower. I already have batteries for the other items so did not order the battery for this one. I have a very small backyard with some shrubs and bushes that need to be trimmed every two or three weeks. This is lightweight, easy to maneuver and gets the job done very quickly. It's not a commercial size or strength but perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M. Aiello

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic! Super easy to use & lightweight. I had no pro lems trimming my hedges. Used it for at least 30 minutes. Unfortunately, I didn't realize it didn't come with a battery. Wish I had paid more attention. Thankfully I have the B&D leaf blower & weed wacker and they all 3 use the same battery!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and immediately tried it out worked great so far I have a few other B&D items ice had for years and still holding up fine so I bought this even tho I'm a huge Milwaukee fan and own dozens of M12 tools I couldn't pass this up for the price and since I already have several batteries it seems like a good choice
customer_reviews.author: Flew

customer_reviews.title: Good tool- cuts quickly and cleanly
customer_reviews.text: I used this tool to cut a hedge which is about 50 feet long and about 4 feet thick. I was impressed with how well it did the job, and it cut cleanly and quickly. A little longer bar would have been nice. but it is not a problem. I suggest using a 5 Ah battery with this tool. The one I purchased from Amazon is this one:
customer_reviews.author: AceFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool light duty trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool light duty trimmer. I used to have hard time getting rid of the weeds near the fence and corner. Now I use this trimmer to trim the weeds. It works pretty well and now the weed looks like nice bush decoration. I also have a B+D light duty chainsaw powered by battery. I love these battery-powered tools. They are perfect for household use. One thing to mention is that the cutter doesn't move as fast as those gas powered professional ones, so you need to move slower to have a clean flat shave.
customer_reviews.author: XG Feng

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Lightweight. Cutter bar is very sharp. I purchased a blade sheath from eReplacementParts. No more hauling out electrical cords. I will now trim each shrub as is needed instead of waiting for them all to finish new their growth and spending a tiring day all at once. Wish I had bought this sooner. I purchased a blade sheath from eReplacementParts. The price is good and it arrived fast. The part number is 90580554.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W

customer_reviews.title: Good little hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I used to trim back overgrown hedges and bushes and was pleasantly surprised at how well it worked. Uses B&D 20volt battery and does not wear the battery out like some units. No frills or fancy stuff, just a good little inexpensive hedge trimmer. I keep several 20-volt batteries around in chargers so it keeps working. I just oiled and sharpened the blades yesterday so ready for spring overgrowth. Good little hedge trimmer for the money.
customer_reviews.author: M. GUERNSEY

customer_reviews.title: Trimming made easy.
customer_reviews.text: Slices through like a hot knife in butter! Light weight and easy to use. We have hedges along the front of our house, I was done within ten minutes and this included clean up. Looking forward to finish hedging around the yard now...find out how long a single charge will last. And the price for the tool itself (battery and charger not included), man oh man WHAT A SAVING!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Different batteries for equipment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the product thinking The battery for my weed eater would fit these clippers and my life would be easy. No such luck. It appears that most Black and Decker tools require specially made batteries. Good for them selling the products. Not good for me and terrible for the environment. I returned the trimmer and purchased a competitor’s. Now using a cordless leaf blower and drill from that same competitor. I have one compact charging station and interchange the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: MarkMeitzRIC

customer_reviews.title: the tools out last the job
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son. He has used over and over again. Loves to use this one everything he needs to use it for. Trimming trees and plants and the battery last so long. He can be working for hours before he has to stop. I bought him and extra battery and a quick charge. Bought several tools to the black and decker group and he goes and goes and gets so many projects done. He loves the fax the tools are versitale and easy to use. He can change them out and stay on task. He runs out of gas before the tools stop.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Priced right but not very work sturdy
customer_reviews.text: 1st B&D came and it worked great. Exactly 1 month later the thing literally stared smoking as I was using it and then ceased up. Lucky for (strange) me because they very day was the final day to return it for an exchange or refund. Amazon came through like a champ. The new item was on my door by 6 pm the very next day and they sent me a return UPS label. DONE. The hedger is fine. Its 22 inches long and cuts fine but LOUD as hell. I'd buy it again because I have 2 -20v batteries and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: PANIRUD

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're too lazy to use shears all day
customer_reviews.text: I've cut my bushes manually with shears before, and the result is good enough, but I need my arms for sitting and holding my various remotes. Therefore, this contraption has helped me greatly to cut more bushes quickly with less arm usage. If you're running out of battery before you've finished cutting your bushes, you either have too many bushes or you're doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Just some guy

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This cordless hedge trimmer is just what I wanted. I use it to quickly trim overgrown brush along property lines, sidewalks, driveways and trails. No longer need l o n g extension cords. Battery life, power and portability are great for this price point. Uses the same batteries that my other B&D tools use. Chews through everything I can get it's teeth into.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry .

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good trimmer. Solidly built, easy to handle, good power, and surprisingly, the battery (when fully charged) lasts longer than I expected. It's so much more convenient than dragging an electric cord through a maze going in and out of the shrubs. This is a great addition to my previous purchases of the leaf blower and string trimmer. The batteries are 100% interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Svitzer

customer_reviews.title: New lighter batteries make this a great tool
customer_reviews.text: For years I used the old B&D hedge trimmer with the big, heavy rechargeable batteries. It worked well, but it was heavy and the batteries wouldn't last long. The new-style lithium batteries are much lighter and last much longer, making this tool great to use. I've also got a long-handled hedge trimmer. In combination, I can handle all of my shrubs now--and the batteries are interchangeable with my B&D weed-whacker and blower.
customer_reviews.author: MFD in SC

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmers, plenty of cutting power. I chose them because I have other tools in the B&D 20V Max line and this allows me to swap batteries around so I always have a charge. Battery life depends on how heavy the work is. If your just trimming hedges, it should last a long time. However, it cuts stuff up to 3/4”, and if you do a lot of that, it will wear the battery down faster, as you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Works good, no battery
customer_reviews.text: I love the hedge trimmer. Just what I needed. I knew it did not come with a battery and that was fine since I had some 20 volt batteries and a charger . But the one for the hedge trimmer is made differently.( of course). So,I had to buy the one that fits this. Paid almost as much for it. But the hedger works well and was cheap enough.
customer_reviews.author: Merrymakers

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this, and immediately tried it out on a couple of my evergreen boxwood shrubs. It worked well beyond my expectations! It's not too heavy for a "mature" woman, and I was able to shape up my shrubs in a matter of minutes. I was already a fan of the 20v Black and Decker tools, and I have a lot of them. I am just as pleased with this tool as am with the ones I already have.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great hedge and bush trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is awesome. I was a little skeptical due to it being cordless but it sure trim our bushes well and is as powerful as if it's plugged in. It's also not very heavy so that's a big plus. I love the fact that it's cordless and you don't have the cords getting in the way while you trim. The only thing is you have to purchase the batteries and charger separately since it doesn't come with them. Overall, I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: OCFamily

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowners light to medium use trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Great home owners trimmer. This is not a commercial grade tool, it is a home owners grade and a very good one at that. The 22 inch blade is fine for most trimming and the cut speed is a little slower to conserve battery life. I maintain my blade with silicon spray after each use. This is a light duty tool and should last many years if you don't push its limits. What is nice, you can purchase heavy duty after market batteries which can double your work time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Another good tool from B+D
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works really well for medium to small jobs around the yard where the ease of use is more important than high power. The batteries last a long time and the trimmer cuts at full power until the battery dies. I have three of these batteries (from weed-eater, trimmer, and the blower) which makes life a lot easier if the battery dies. My other B+D tools have aged well and I expect this to do the same. One safety concern, it's a little too easy to run this trimmer with one hand. You have to let the handle almost all the way out before the blades stop, so be careful when swinging this around.
customer_reviews.author: BlindOne

customer_reviews.title: Compatible
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a Toro I had that broke. I have a bunch of Porter Cable 20volt tools. I took a chance since BD owns DeWalt and PC that the batteries are the same. BD added a small plastic tab that broke off easily to allow use of the 20 volt Porter Cable batteries. Got about 2 hours of straight use so far and am not disappointed. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight making the trimmers very maneuverable at all angles. For my needs a shorter set of blades might have been better but it is nice having the longer set for bigger jobs some day. My only complaint was no instruction that I could find on blade lubrication or what to use for this but was easily searchable online. I did about 10 bushes of 4 foot size and still haven't used up a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jman

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, should have upgraded to this years ago
customer_reviews.text: Just love this, as do I love the 20V Max batteries. I got this after years of lugging around an extension cord, and I wish I would've gotten this years before. I now have a great string trimmer and this to go with a pair of the 20V Max batteries, and they both work fantastically. The batteries seem to last far longer than I would need, and I have a LOT of trimming to do, decent sized front yard and huge back yard with tons of bushes and plant islands. Great product, cuts fast, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit Face

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional landscaper. I am a homeowner that just needed a hedge trimmer once a month for touch up. This trimmer is fantastic. I own the hedge trimmer, string trimmer and blower/sweeper. They are all perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Billy B

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be quite well-made but its best asset for me is convenience. I have another corded hedge trimmer which is rarely used due to the hassle of getting out a 100' extension cord. This unit is just "grab 'n go' since I already had 4-20v B&D batteries. Most of my trimming is relatively small bushes & hedges but have cut up to 1/2" branches with this. I bought the tool alone w/o battery.
customer_reviews.author: pjc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Dependable and strong!
customer_reviews.text: For a cordless landscaping tool, this works tremendously well. Lightweight and comfortable to use. Very powerful. Makes short work of overgrowth and routine trimming. Cordless versatility is a major plus, along with the convenience of the interchangeable battery system.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: Used the trimmer for the first time today to trim 4 bushes in the back yard. It was amazing. Absolutely love not having to use an extension cord to do the job. No more wasted time fiddling with the cord: getting it out, uncoiling, finding an outlet, keeping cord away from blades while trimming, recoiling, putting the cord away. What normally takes me an hour to do now takes 10 minutes. The 20v version worked well and the teimmer had more than enough battery power to do the job. Superb buy and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a B&D set of battery operated lawn tools. They were not expensive and i did not expect much; but i was pleasantly surprised, I could trim and use the blower for my entire lawn on 1 battery. Solid and powerful and LIGHT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: What I especially love about this product is that I was able to buy it without the battery because I have a Black Decker drill that uses the same battery! In addition, the trimmer works great trimming all the hedges in front and sides of my home. It won't cut thick branches, but then that's not it's purpose. And it's not for commercial use. But for my purposes, i's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kramer

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it; therefore he actually uses it : )
customer_reviews.text: It’s light-weight, holds a charge, and slices thru hedges, which makes my husband happy to use it. So, he actually goes at those hedges with gusto. No more cranky avoidance. Happy husband = very happy wife.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for light homeowner use
customer_reviews.text: Works ok as long as the material is not too thick. When I first used it it started smoking, but the smoke went away in a minute or so... perhaps burning off some oil on a hot part. I like that this it light weight and uses the same battery as other B&D 20 volt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Look no further than this Cordless Black and Decker Hedge Trimmer.  The real deal.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a great, lightweight cordless hedge trimmer, look no further. This Black and Decker LHT2220 20 Volt Lithium is the real deal. This little trimmer makes fun of cutting your hedges. I can't believe how powerful this trimmer is and how fast I could trim my bushes. Ok well, all I can say is stop your search for a cordless hedge trimmer. This one is the real deal. Will try to upload the video to YouTube. Can't seem to get it to load on Amazon reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Herman F. East

customer_reviews.title: Used Like New, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This item was sold as Used Like New. It looked new, box was damaged. I ordered without batteries. I have 2 batteries that came with my Black and Decker weed eater. It’s a couple of years old but the batteries still charge good so I was able to save some money.
customer_reviews.author: JoyceB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Goes great with all my other 20v tools. More than enough battery to do all my hedges and shrubs in one time. No more having to drag a cord around or having to stop 2/3 of the way done to recharge battery. Lightweight so doesnt get tiring after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: tommyb

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Geeze. I wish I would have purchase one of these trimmers years ago. Always did it by hand before for yard work. This B&D unit is what it is A basic trimmer for light use. If it last three or four years I'll be happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: llacosse

customer_reviews.title: Should have purchased this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hedge trimmer. I have been using garden shears all this time and have dreaded trimming hedges and small trees. Now, the work is a breeze, takes about 1/5 of the time, and is actually enjoyable. I have not had the trimmer long, so I cannot speak for longevity, but it has worked just as advertised so far. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for light garden trimming
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight but reasonably powerful trimmer. It cuts through shrubs and bushes easily. It also uses the same battery as my drill and circular saw which makes it very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Charlies Pal

customer_reviews.title: Serious safety issue.
customer_reviews.text: The power on trigger runs the length of the handle. You must release your grip on the handle to power off the tool, thus loss of control of the tool. If I could send it back, I would. I will dismantle it and send it to recycle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maloy

customer_reviews.title: Good on battery
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is ok, however,the length and the hand guard are not up to convenience. Too short for my shrubs, and when inverted for very tall shrubs,the hand guard gets in the way always, specially because it's a short trimmer. But on the other hand, it really cuts well. It's not a fast cutting machine, but it is economical on the battery, just like my blower. Even a 1.5 amp battery will suffice for all my shrubs, and I have quite a few of them.Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Miguel Berard

customer_reviews.title: Ya gotta love it!
customer_reviews.text: Time saver, strong and great value. I cleared over an acre of green briar and poison ivy with my first one a few years ago and used it often trimming hedges at home and both of my children’s properties. It just died and I replaced it with this one - same model and seems just as smooth.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Canapabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Much more convenient than similar corded model
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar corded Black & Decker hedge trimmer that I use with a 100 foot cord. This new battery operated trimmer is so much more convenient to use. I find this trimmer cuts very well and saves time by not having to drag a heavy cord around. I am very pleased with this purchase. I already had four 20 volt batteries that I can use with this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cordless makes it very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this cordless hedge trimmer, it cut through hedges like butter and no cord to have to drag around and worry about cutting into, and when your finished just hang it up and no hassles with winding a cord up
customer_reviews.author: maddie 07

customer_reviews.title: I should've bought this years ago...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an idiot. I only have a half dozen bushes in my yard, and I originally bought a hand snipper. Then I bought shears. Then I bought this. This trimmer works so quickly and painlessly, I can't believe I wasted money on other tools. Should've just bought this straight away.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a new cordless. Tried again to use a corded and cut the extension cord in the first minute. Happens every time. This is super sharp and light. Good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Marcusalexander

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and cut the cord 😀
customer_reviews.text: Oh my! Trimming bushes and small the trees without having to worry about cutting the extension cord? Wow. I love this tool. I bought the bare tool because I already have two charges and several batteries. I am 66 and l can maneuver this thing with 1 hand. Very good battery time. I have several large Azalea bushes and hedges. It usually takes 2 batteries to complete the job. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: tinyhousebuilder

customer_reviews.title: So convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I can't write a review on the reliability of this item as we've only used it twice. For those two times of use, we absolutely find it far better than having to trail 10s of feet of cords. We have a number of Black and Decker battery powered lawn tools and have no complaints about any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Marie F

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard trimming
customer_reviews.text: For the money it is a great trimmer for small branches and just trimming up you hedges. A lot more quiet than a gas powered model. I ordered it without charger /battery because I already use a 20v b&d drill and saw
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The blades are sharp and it is light weight, easily maneuverable! No worries about cutting the cord by accident (been there). My wife used it so far and these are her words.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hare

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered tools are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Fired my gardener. With this hedge trimmer and other battery powered tools I can do my yard myself (I am 77 years old) saving lots of money and great exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B

customer_reviews.title: Great additional to my max 20v series
customer_reviews.text: Love the 20v series as I have several tools now and happy to add another to the collection. Reviews were all excellent so I had high hopes in replacing my older electric hedger. Did the job but didn't seem to cut as quickly and smoothly as my old yard man hedger. Still does the job and holds a charge for awhile and even if it doesn't, it takes a second to put a fresh battery in. That is my pet peeve with battery tools that aren't universal as no one wants to wait an hour let alone 4 hours to recharge and finish what could have been a quick job.
customer_reviews.author: Snommer

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job, not great, as long as branches aren't too thick -- it is a trimmer after all. Lighter than expected and battery life was also longer than expected. Part of my growing arsenal of B&D electric tools.
customer_reviews.author: Le Capitaine

customer_reviews.title: Still going...
customer_reviews.text: Quality: Solid and workmanship is very good. Performance: It can get a little noisy but nothing out of the ordinary. The teeth work well. My use: I use this to clean up wall-bushes, shrubs, and vines. I use it in all angles and it doesn't impact performance.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable Enough
customer_reviews.text: I've had this trimmer for about eight months, and use it about once a week for less than an hour. But it's starting to make awful metal-on-metal noises inside the handle and I don't think it will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Can be more 'creative' w/cordless shears! No worries 'bout cuttin' cords. Can hold @ any angle--instant stop when YOU want! Can take on a 1/4" branch easily and can be stopped halfway to sharpen blades if they dull. Battery life is enough for ~15min of continuous cutting, but THAT is a lot of cutting! Remember, must REMOVE th' cuttings @ end! Anyway, love th' freedom it gives me, has a guard between You and what you're cutting, is well balanced, and light enough to reach tall stragglers,(one handed)(not recommended), due to its 20" reach, w/out a ladder! Classic Amazon! 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.  Lightweight and very sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, super sharp blades. Cuts easily even with just one hand, if necessary. Appears the blades are stainless (but maybe not, they look like very high quality steel). Not having the cord to worry about is HUGE. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby Checkers

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for trimming up and grooming your yard & more. I strongly recommend getting the Black + Decker line up of wireless tools to Get things done around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with battery or charger
customer_reviews.text: Not happy it didn’t come with charger and battery didn’t find out til it came it said on the box but I had other black decker with the battery and charger so using that for the price it should have came with one but overall works good for small jobs like bushes in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Cordle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and fast shipping. Had a previous model and it lasted five years. Only bought this one because the previous model had a larger older 18 v battery. This one has the lithium 20 v battery. Still using the o,d one st our vacation house.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hawk

customer_reviews.title: This was junk!
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted a few months and died. It turns on but makes grinding noises and won't cut anything. I've tried to contact the manufacturer for warranty repair and have not received a reply. Don't waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very easy to handle, Thanks again B&D!
customer_reviews.text: I love this as much as the LST420 Trimmer I purchased the same day. I have got to say...WOW! It really surprised me how great it works. I did not expect much since the last hedge trimmer I had was a gas-powered trimmer and I never expected something battery powered could even come close but it sure does! It is so light weight and easy to use. Best of all, it uses the same battery as my weed trimmer, so I can interchange the batteries. All my shrubs are nice and groomed now, without the hassle and danger of storing a gas cans. Thank you again B&D!
customer_reviews.author: Lori L.

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life. Feels cheap but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected but this is the first hedge trimmer I’ve owned so I don’t really have anything to compare it too. As with most black and decker tools it feels somewhat cheaply made but I’ve owned it for over a month, putting it through its paces, I haven’t had anything go wrong. The battery life is better than I expected also.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: FAR better than the cord trimmers that I've used all my life. If you have a lot of bushes, get an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Cube

customer_reviews.title: Everyone who owns 20v tools needs this trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple review....BUY THIS TRIMMER! I have had great luck with B&D 20v tools for some time now and enjoy them all. I think this trimmer is the best investment I ever made! The portability is priceless! Worth every penny....plain and simple!
customer_reviews.author: KW John

customer_reviews.title: Great hedger for lighter use
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't think such a light piece of equipment would work so well, but it does. I first used on large trellis of jasmine; cut through it easily. Next on jasmine in a planter which had thick wood stems, and it took some more effort but cut through 1/4 inch easily. For the price point I think this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with capabilities of this hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Really works well. I use it with a 4AH porter cable battery which lasts far longer than I need to trim all the holly's and forsythias we have.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once so far. trimmed my hedge and several bushes. It is easy to use and much lighter than dragging the electric cord with me! Happy with the results! I had batteries already. Haven't used up all the power in the first one yet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product at a low price. Good for a smallish to medium property. Just don’t expect the same “oomph” of an electric powered hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Howell

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I got lots 20V battery to operate tools, it gets the job done easily without worry about cut the power cord; if the tool is a liittle lighter, it will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lin

customer_reviews.title: Trimmed back the bushes beautifully. My neighbors do not take care of their ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for bushes and very small branches. Does exactly what I need it to do, which is give my fence line a haircut. Trimmed back the bushes beautifully. My neighbors do not take care of their yard and the bushes start to consume my fence. This causes me to lose lots of square footage of dog running room. It also creates a canopy over my flowers causing them to die. This thing is not super powerful, but the battery lasts long enough for the job that I need done. My hands feel very strange after operating the tool for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Vines

customer_reviews.title: I have been burned by battery operated devices like this in the past but Black and Decker has ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the real McCoy. I have been burned by battery operated devices like this in the past but Black and Decker has finally mastered this technology. I had a gas powered hedge trimmer that was always a problem to start. When I got this battery powered one it worked great the first time out of the box. It has plenty of power to handle all but the toughest trim jobs and the optional larger battery was still going strong after 30 minutes. I might add that it is very light weight which makes handling very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rider

customer_reviews.title: Good for light to medium duty
customer_reviews.text: If I were a gardener, I’d hate this tool. As a homeowner, I like it. It is just a bit underpowered. Grass and hedge cuts are easy, but big stems can be a challenge. Cutting exactly perpendicular helps.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer. I have two large capacity batteries that I use, and have yet to drain one while using it. I trimmed for about an hour, with no slowdown at all. It cuts great, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that this trimmer may not be strong enough to do the job, but I was wrong. Plenty of battery life too!
customer_reviews.author: Wwjoesr

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: this was better than i expected. it make quick work of trimming the hedges and the battery i had from my b&d trimmer fit and it lasts a long time
customer_reviews.author: Cory S

customer_reviews.title: Nice bush trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I use this to trim our little tree bush which has really strong branches. I also trim our tall grass bushes. Works really well, has a safety button for the trigger. Tricky part is that it does not come with a battery. I had to buy one separately which costs more than this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't cut large bush branches
customer_reviews.text: Burn't out the motor on the first one I purchased but that was my fault, used it on old heavy tall bushes that required a gas or electric trimmer. Used it many times on my other shrubs and bushes and it works great, nice not to lug a cord around and gets the job done on a single battery charge. Missed it so much I had to buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this trimmer. I have a gas powered trimmer and also an electric trimmer but I never use them now that I got this one. It cuts nicely, Is lightweight, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: So far this unit has been a great surprise! It cuts through branches that I thought would shut it down quick. So handy not to deal with the extension cord for a 100 feet. I bought the quick charger and use the batteries off my drill as well. But the one battery off my blower will do the whole yard on one charge. Good purchase and has kept the yard looking better due to it is so easy and handy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Swenson

customer_reviews.title: power to spare
customer_reviews.text: Suprised at how sharp and powerful this tool is. Just do not grab the moving bar cutters as my wife di. Great too to own for trimming bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cutter
customer_reviews.text: So much better that one with a cord. Does its job well. The battery lasts plenty long and hold its charge will sitting on the shelf (also interchangeable with several other B&D yard products, which is nice).
customer_reviews.author: david w

Style:20V Hedge Trimmer (Tool Only)The BLACK+DECKER Bare 20V MAX Lithium Ion Cordless 22" Hedge Trimmer is ideal for trimming hedges, shrubs and bushes without extension cords. It has 22 inch dual action blades which cut branches faster and easier with 40 percent less vibration. This unit is compatible with 20V Lithium Ion rechargeable battery delivering power and run time for most trimming jobs (battery and charger not included). It quickly cuts branches up to 3/4 inch thick. This trimmer can also handle up to 3000 sq ft of actual hedges trimmed per charge. It features a full wrap around front handle which provides a comfortable gripping area in all cutting orientations, along with soft grips for comfortable use and secure gripping. Included Components: (1) LHT2220 Trimmer, (1) 20V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery, (1) Battery Charger; Power Source: Lithium Ion; Type: Hedge Trimmer

AMAZON.COM


The cordless LHT2220B hedge trimmer (view larger). Get the power you need with Black & Decker's 20-volt lithium system (view larger). You'll have your entire yard looking neat and trim in no time with the Black & Decker LHT2220B 20-volt MAX Lithium 22-inch cordless hedge trimmer. It's full of features that not only make it comfortable and easy to use for big jobs, but also make it agile and precise enough to get professional-looking results.

First, there's the full wrap-around front handle. It gives you a cushioned gripping area in all cutting orientations so you can carve precise edges high or low, remove deep growth, and precisely shape hedges and brush with ease. It cuts branches up to 3/4-inch in diameter, so even large shrubbery and overgrown landscapes are no problem.

Note: This Black & Decker cordless tool does not come with a 20-volt MAX lithium-ion battery. It's a good choice if you already have other batteries purchased with other tools from Black & Decker's 20-volt MAX Lithium lineup. If you need a battery, this hedge trimmer comes in a package that includes a battery and charger, or you can purchase a LBXR20 battery separately.

MAKE QUICK CUTS IN COMFORT
Comfortable and easy to use from start to finish, the LHT2220B hedge trimmer's 22-inch dual-action blades cut quickly and cleanly, so cutting takes less effort. And with 40 percent less vibration than similar trimmers, fatigue won't slow you down — so you can work until your yard is looking its best.

The LHT2220B also comes with a blade cover for safe handling and extended blade life.

TWICE THE BATTERY LIFE
Hedge trimming is not a job you want to leave half-finished, and the Black & Decker 20-volt MAX Lithium 22-inch cordless hedge trimmer won't leave you in the lurch. It's been tested and proven to trim up to 3,000 square feet in a single charge. The separately available 20-volt MAX lithium-ion battery offers a longer lifespan and retains its charge 5x longer than similar 18-volt NiCad batteries. It's compatible with the full line of Black & Decker's 20-volt MAX line of power and gardening tools, and you won't be limited by an extension cord.
